title: Music Therapy
shortDescription: Uses music interventions to address communication, social, and emotional goals.
description: Music therapy is an evidence-based therapeutic approach that uses music interventions to accomplish individualized goals. For children with autism, music therapy can be particularly effective because many individuals on the spectrum show enhanced musical abilities and strong responses to music. Board-certified music therapists use singing, instrument playing, songwriting, and movement to music to address communication skills, social interaction, emotional regulation, and motor coordination. Music provides a structured yet flexible medium that can reduce anxiety and increase engagement.
benefits: Enhances social interaction and turn-taking skills
Provides sensory input in a structured way
Builds motor coordination through instrument play
whoCanBenefit: Children who respond positively to music
Children needing support with emotional regulation
Those who struggle with traditional therapy approaches
